comment.author: 37865451@N00
comment._content: Probably The Richeson Case - death of Avis Linnell "In 1911, the 35-year-old Richeson was thisclose to marrying a wealthy heiress and daughter of a Boston Brahmin when he had the misfortune of impregnating one of his conquests, an 18-year-old choir singer named Avis Linnell. As a result of the difficult position he found himself in, like so many others, Richeson chose murder as the solution to his problems." markgribben.com/index.php?cat=13&paged=1 "Moses Grant Edmands, father of the accused clergyman's fiancee" - witness in the case "in the employ of Philip R. Dunbar to gather evidence for the defense." query.nytimes.com/mem/archive-free/pdf?res=9402E7DE1231E2... October 27, 1911 query.nytimes.com/mem/archive-free/pdf?res=9F05E5DF1231E2...
